author: Alex R
text: 'Prices are high
column5: but food is unrefined. Can find better easily. Service is not bad. New decore is comfy. They just need to make food with better recepies.'

author: Simon Myoung
text: 'ㅇㅇ 졸맛임 추천 아저씨도 친근함 강추'

author: cristina marin
text: 'Great food and service!'

author: Kapil Gupta
text: 'Tasty food.'

author: Ari Jiang
text: 'We just moved to Hoboken and saw this place has hotpot so decided to try it. Do NOT recommend. I can make much better hotpot at home that’ll cost less. The hotpot we had there was pathetic. Ugh. What they make is so amateur and is overpriced for what it is. If you want authentic hotpot go to Manhattan
column5: LIC or best - flushing. If you don’t wanna travel
column6:
do yourself a favor and go to h mart and just buy ingredients there.

Only reason not giving a lower star is that the younger waiter was very considerate and caring. We really appreciate his service - hope you find a better place to work.

We’ll try this place’s regular dishes and revise review if needed.'

author: Lalit Bansal
text: 'Such a delicious food! Too impressed!'

author: Auston Tighe
text: 'Prices for Hoboken were reasonable. Food was really good I had the duck and was able to try their beef noodle bowl. Broth in the bowl was thick
column5: had volume and depth. All around good place with nice pricing and hours.'

author: Katrina Cheung
text: 'Some of the best Chinese food I’ve ever had and it takes a lot for me to say that as a Chinese person. Love their beef and broccoli
column5: the chicken fried rice and their chicken wings. Everything is always so good and it doesn’t make you feel bleh afterwards which is great.'

author: Michael Quinlan
text: "Excellent food
column5: great service.  My only regret is that I ordered pork fried rice thinking I was specifying the type of rice that went with my lunch special
column6: when what I actually received was a meal-sized portion in addition to my meal.  It was delicious nonetheless!  I'd go back again soon if it weren't for all the other places in Hoboken I have yet to try."

author: J F
text: 'Food was disgusting. Chicken was inedible. People must have terrible taste in food to think this is actually good.'

author: Allison Serries
text: "Love this place! It's like a gourmet Chinese restaurant. Very happy professional service. The food is amazing. I tried almost everything on the menu and still not disappointed. It's BYOB. Very convenient location being that a liquor store is next door. My husband is very picky with food and he can't stop talking about how delicious the food is. Number one Chinese dining in Hoboken. Oh
column5: and if you like spicy
column6: they'll recommend a really good dish! I recommend the cucumber appetizer to calm down the spice if you dare to go spicy!"

author: Piush K
text: 'The food is good. I would rate above average. However
column5: they brought the order one by one with a significant wait in between. The service could be better.'

author: Anukrati Khare
text: 'Good food.\nIts super busy place although I went during weekday
column5: so the only issue is they got our order one at a time which was not expected.'

author: sunghee kim
text: 'Nice and essential selection for hot pot! Glad for that hoboken has this decent Chinese place to dine in.'

author: Maria Isabel Moreno
text: 'An a casual arrive!!! But an amazing surprise!!! The best Chinese restaurant I’ve ever had! Everything was delicious! I highly recommend this place!'

author: Lindsay Macolino
text: 'Hands down best Asian food I’ve had in Hoboken. The quality of the food is out of this world
column5: we order from here almost every week!! We love the soup dumplings
column6: beef dumplings

author: Greg Monchak
text: 'Hands down best chinese meal ever. Do yourself a favor and order C9 "Chicken Home Style" if you like spicy. It is fantastic!!'

author: Celeste Perlez
text: 'Food was not that great. Worst dumplings I’ve ever had (really thick
column5: sticky
column6: and not enough filling) and the food was bland.'

author: Brian Fang
text: 'Very good!'

author: Nina Akhigbe
text: 'ummmmm i dont like spicy food'

author: Tina Ahuja
text: 'This is hands down my favorite Chinese food place in all of Hoboken. Found when looking up "best dumplings in Hoboken" 2 years ago and that\'s for sure
column5: they are pretty damn good. Their other best dishes in my opinion are the chicken and broccoli along with the sesame chicken. For upscale quality Chinese food
column6: the prices are very reasonable. Recommend to anyone and everyone!'

author: David Orr
text: 'Nice outdoor dining spot
column5: they have four or five tables in a parklet. Lunch was good
column6: a step up from standard Chinese takeout.'

author: Sophia T
text: "How can people rate this so well! Horrible food
column5: do not order the miso soup and it's not even cheap\nEdit: it was the wonton soup
column6: sorry"

author: Karen N
text: 'Isn’t it illegal to charge prices that aren’t on the menu in the restaurant or online? This has happened twice. We’ve ordered take out and have been told
column5: “oh
column6: this is not $11
column7: it’s actually $15 now but none of our menus have been updated”. Greasy food that comes at a high cost. You’re better off dining at Precious closer to the PATH station than at Keming. Disappointing. Also
column8: there’s no way you can hydrate enough after all the MSG that is put into the food - not great on your health or your wallet.'

author: David N Rosensaft
text: 'Just OK.  Soup very salty.  Main dish not quite as represented on menu.  Cold sesame noodles were fine.'

author: Aja Koenig
text: "Since the beginning of quarantine
column5:
our normal go-to Chinese restaurant has been shut down. I had heard great things about Keming and we finally tried it. It was GREAT! The order arrived on time and was nice and hot! Here is my review on each item we ordered:

String Beans w/min Pork- DELICIOUS!!!!
Spicy Dan Dan Noodles - Amazing! I haven't had these anywhere else
column6: so I don't have anything to compare them to
column7: but I loved them! I am always looking for spicy noodle dishes and they are hard to find at most places in Hoboken. These hit the spot and the spice level was on point!\nBeef Lo Mein - My husband enjoyed it. I tasted it and it was on par with other places. Also
column8: not one of my favorite dishes in general so I don't care. As long as he liked it
column9: we are good to go.\nEgg Rolls- Decent
column10: not amazing. More like Spring Rolls
column12: but basic here.\nBeef Dumplings - AMAZING! I love the thickness of the dumpling and the beef had great flavor.\nWonton in Spicy Sauce- OK. The meat inside was mediocre
column13:
but the spicy sauce was delicious.
Wonton Soup- Disappointing. Very bland.

We went a little crazy on how much we ordered because we wanted to try a lot of different things. Can't wait to order again and try more! I recommend trying Keming if you have not done so.  Great find!"

author: William Brent Rudderham
text: 'Ate there again and food was terrific! Piping hot
column5: fresh  and delicious. My #1 go to for Chinese food in Hoboken'

author: JoAnna
text: 'Best fried rice!!!'

author: Darren Jones
text: 'Can’t get enough of this place. Been eating here for a few years now. It’s a staple for us every few weeks. Hot and sour soup is a must
column5: along with the steamed fresh pork and cabbage dumplings. They also have a ton of actual authentic dishes so we try to mix one in with our orders.\n\nThanks for the great food! See you again in a few weeks when I my wife and I need our fix.'

author: Lydia Ratchinsky
text: 'You pay more to get less'

author: Tanya Tang
text: 'Mediocre'

author: Junking H
text: 'I was so socked when I realized that they used paper box for the juicy foods. The oily source of the food leaked and my car got extremely disgusted.'

author: Rajesh Sanghvi
text: 'I tried this spot before with a friend and I am addicted since then. I loved the fantastic mood and delicious food and drinks. Fantastic work.'

author: Kareem K
text: 'Had a great experience in this place with my wife. The food comes out fast and the service is just good. Prices are reasonable.'

author: Jared McGinley
text: 'Food was great!'

author: Jack Pepkowski
text: 'Beef chow fun was awful. Makes me never want to order Chinese takeout again.'

author: Bharat Bhushan
text: "Not a good place for folks who don't like spicy food..."

author: Verena Geheim
text: 'Very good place. Excellent service and good quality food. Looking forward to the next visit :)'

author: Venkata Kishore Bondada
text: 'Ambience is ok. Menu is good. Taste is very good. Every dish is served with rice. The quantity is sufficient for one person. The price is ok not too high. Tofu is well cooked.'

author: Juan David Estrada Coca
text: 'Ordered a delivery and they brought me the food with no forks or anything
column5: no sauces nothing!
column6: plus theybare way to expensive compare to others chinese restaurants.'

author: Audrey Wong
text: 'Tried the vegetable lo mein and chicken dumplings. The food was delicious and the staff was very friendly. I would come back again to try the other menu items next time.'

author: Hudson Shi
text:
'(Translated by Google) There are too few seafood in seafood saucepans.

(Original)
海鲜香锅里海鲜太少了'

author: Vincent Tchong
text: 'Expensive but decent tasting
column5: authentic Chinese food. Food has a lot of oil and salt in it
column6: so just a heads up.'

author: Changchun Zhao
text:
'(Translated by Google) Authentic Chinese food

(Original)
正宗中餐'

author: Dan Ostrach
text: "Authentic
column5: flavorful
column6: and delicious food. The staff is unfailingly polite and friendly
column7: and the service is fast. Can't go wrong here!"

author: Morgan Burch
text: 'HOLY HELL YES! The Szechuan pork & Szechuan beef is fiery heaven on earth. Yes. In love.'

author: Merit Ohare
text: "First
column5: let me say that I've visited Ke Ming several times with friends and family
column6: and it's been amazing -- great food
column8: etc.\n\nI'm writing because I was really disappointed in the takeout I ordered tonight
column9: which was ostensibly mixed vegetables but was actually 50% celery
column10: with the rest being water chestnuts and green peppers.  This is hardly a $13 mix of veggies.  I hope the restaurant is more thoughtful in the future about the quality of food they're serving."

author: Timothy R.
text: 'Our food was heated using microwave
column5: SERIOUSLY??!!! It came cold in the center. We didn’t ask to reheat it bc we were very unhappy and left half of the food untouched.\nOverpriced on everything.'

author: Lingfeng Xue
text: 'The taste reminds me of the feeling in my hometown of China👍'

author: Belkys
text: 'I just went to this Chinese restaurant today and had the shrimp general tso and it was soooooo good and fresh. It came with white rice. The portion are big enough for one person. Unless you order other dishes to share. This dish had around 8 pieces of shrimp. The place is cozy and neat. Really good first time impression!!\nWill definitely go back and recommend.'

author: Xinqiang Shi
text: 'Good service and food.'

author: 林淑芳
text: 'Best Chinese food in town
column5: very authentic.'

author: Pablo Nolasco
text: 'Fresh
column5: clean
column6: Good service.'

author: Iris Lin
text: 'Food not tasty at all. price is high. not worth the money.'

author: Rodrigo Nogueira
text: 'Very nice Chinese place !!\nI live nearby and always get some food there.  Juicy pork dumpling
column5: Kum Pao chicken
column6: curry chicken
column8: I highly recommend all.\nAlso very cozy for sit-in dinner.'

author: Kathleen Guner
text: 'Delicious!'

author: Amanda Gonzalez
text: 'A clean restaurant with really good food. I would definitely come here again'

author: Jerry Wohlgemuth
text: "This is one of my favorite restaurants in Hoboken. We used to go for hot pot when it was available on the weekend
column5: but now I think you can only get it during the week. The boiled fish and beef Szechuan style are spicy and excellent. All the veggie dishes we've had have been great
column6: particularly the eggplant and home style string beans. It's a great place to branch out from your usual Chinese food order."

author: Poohlein Rampen
text: "I've only done takeout
column5: and all the dishes so far were great. Had the string beans with pork
column6: shredded beef with spicy pepper
column7: and dry sauteed cabbage. Not Americanized.\n\nI've a feeling this is one of those places where you can get truly authentic Sichuan dishes
column8: if you only knew what to order.  A pity that I don't speak Sichuanese Mandarin."

author: James McCann
text: "Have been here perhaps a dozen times. Best Chinese food in Hoboken. This is not typical gloppy
column5: strip-mall (or Hudson County) Chinese.  Portions are a little smaller and quality much higher. Food listed as spicy is actually spicy. The sweet and sour pork is... sweet and sour. There are some dishes that were new to me but I have enjoyed everything that I've tried
column6: some things more than others. In particular have enjoyed the fish and tofu dishes
column7: as well as standards like dumplings. My kids love the sesame chicken and here it's actually good. Staff is very friendly. Puzzled by some of the negative reviews below
column8: which seem to be from people who have visited once. My experience (again over many visits) has been very good.\nBYOB is nice... there is liquor store next door."

author: Namrata Chakrabarti
text: 'This place is phenomenal! Best Chinese restaurant in Hoboken! Everything we tried was absolutely delicious and the wait staff were the nicest!'

author: Teresa Pennington
text: 'Best chinese food in san francisco (Indians will love the taste) - Ask for extra spicy in all the dishes you order'

author: Yudong Cao
text: 'The meat is suspect
column5: taste not as good as before'

author: Kim Schönthal
text: '(Translated by Google) Delicious food
column5:
reasonable prices! Alcohol can be brought along as none is served. Quiet atmosphere suitable for a small group or for two.

(Original)
Leckeres Essen
column6: angemessene Preise! Alkohol kann mitgebracht werden
column7: da keiner ausgeschenkt wird. Ruhige Atmosphäre geeignet für eine kleine Gruppe bzw. zu zweit.'

author: Joisy Mejias
text: 'Delicious food and excellent service!'

author: Lauren Sachs
text: 'My favorite Chinese place in Hoboken! Their soup dumplings are incredible'

author: Tonya Schwartz
text: 'Amazing soup dumplings! (Steamed pork juicy buns) Big fans of their sesame noodles too!'

author: Zhaohui Ma
text: "My friends am I came to there. And we saw someone's long hair in our food. But the waiter changed the food so quick."

author: Sian Foulkes
text: 'Surprised having seen such good reviews
column5: but the food wasn’t good. Four of us dined and found each dish gloopy and the meat tough.'

author: Aaron Beveridge
text: "Not good. Ordered sesame chicken for my wife - she thought it was fairly good. I ordered chicken home style - it was awful - the breading was so salty it was barely edible (and I like salt). I ordered lo mein and fried rice for the kids. The only detectable flavor in the lo mein was garlic. The fried rice was average at best. The worst part about it was the price. It was about $60. Maybe an off night for them but won't give it another shot."

author: Chris Skarantonakis
text: 'so ordered a large shrimp fried rice for 10$.No sauce in the bag? Also 5 tiny shrimps for large order? complete ripoff.there was no shrimp to be found.Never again'

author: gary dawson
text: 'Fried rice was too sticky and had no flavor and their half chicken was the size of a pigeon'

author: Dylan Wong
text: 'Beef chow fun and hot pot so good!!!!!!'

author: Zimeng Cheng
text: 'I like this place. The dishes are delicious. Just 30% more expansive than expected. Will come again.'

author: Gene Levin
text: 'Szechuan food in Hoboken! Owner and staff are super friendly--great quality takeout and an awesome stop for group meals (or couples or solo
column5: whatever
column6: just go).'

author: Bob Zhong
text: 'Very good traditional Chinese
column5: and also nice stuff here. Recommend it.'

author: Sam Grala
text: 'Great service and even better food!'

author: Susan Cunningham
text: 'Good food. We had Kung Pau
column5: fried rice. Service was good but food came out at different times so hard to eat all together.  Good prices.'

author: Rooni Mathew
text: 'Hands down
column5: the best Chinese restaurant in Hoboken.'

author: Bo Zhang
text: "Well
column5: this a Chinese food restaurant. It has traditional Chinese flavor. I don't suggest go there too often. Cause you will feel very thing tastes the same. But there are a lot of food you can try. Some noodles are very delicious. I think the only bad thing is the price is a little expensive. However
column6: I am Chinese guy
column7: but I saw many native people eating there."

author: Brendan O'Donnell
text: 'Fantastic szechuan food'

author: Julian Villacorta
text: 'Best Chinese place hands down! No1 such a lie.'

author: Lauren Foster
text: 'Good soup dumplings and wontons in chili oil'

author: Henry Cabrera
text: "I'm from new york came all the way down here for this great food🖒🖒"

author: Likey Li
text: "(Translated by Google) It's so delicious
column5: we recommend saliva chicken
column6: cumin lamb
column7:
and burdock noodles. Good enough

(Original)
太好吃了，墙裂推荐口水鸡和孜然羊肉，还有牛腩面。很够味道"

author: Cristin Cricco-Powell
text: "I'm a Hoboken native and have always wondered why Hoboken had such mediocre Chinese restaurants. That's finally changed. Keming is delicious
column5: and it's legit Sichuan cuisine. We ate in
column6: and service was fantastic. Friendly
column8: and very sweet with the four small children we brought with us. Definitely my new spot."

author: Melanie Tam
text: "For a 9 o'clock on a Thursday
column5: there were still a good few tables dining. We ordered the soup dumplings and the beef lomein. The soup dumplings taste slightly better than the frozen ones you would buy at a Chinese supermarket. The lomein is also a level better than one you'd order from a typical takeout place. I would say Keming is a good option if you want Chinese
column6: but don't want takeout. It seems pretty authentic for the area. Plus they have a Szechuan hot pot
column7: which I'll be back to try!\n\nTip - BYOB! There's a liquor store right next door (but it's a bit pricy)"

author: kirby M Green
text: 'Excellent food great service great date spot'

author: vinod bang
text: 'came here with coworkers for Friday lunch. No one liked the food. So we asked for chilli sauce
column5: just to finish the food. Even the chilli sauce was full of oil and less chilly.'

author: Andrew Price
text: "We often went to Precious (also recommended) which is further south in Hoboken
column5: but when we heard a Chinese restauarant was opening within walking distance of where we lived
column6: we had to give it a try. It's some of the best Chinese food in the greater NYC area. We've eaten in
column7: and also ordered pick up via the phone and our food was ready within 10 minutes."

author: Chuck Thompson
text: 'Amazingly good actual Asian food in the Ho'

author: Wei Xin Yuan
text: 'Came here with a bunch of coworkers for lunch. Food is decent for this location.'

author: 王珏
text: 'Great food and good service. More authentic than other Chinese restaurants'

author: Zheng Su
text: 'Great food. Very friendly owner and staff. Best Chinese food in Hoboken!'
